definitions.definition: A falling off, decay or descent .
The act of declining a word; the act of listing the inflections of a noun, pronoun or adjective in order.
The product of that act; a list of declined forms.
A way of categorizing nouns , pronouns , or adjectives according to the inflections they receive.
examples: In Latin, 'amicus' belongs to the second declension . Most second-declension nouns end in '-i' in the genitive singular and '-um' in the accusative singular.

main_definition: A falling off, decay or descent .
secondary_definitions: ( grammar ) The act of declining a word; the act of listing the inflections of a noun, pronoun or adjective in order.
( grammar ) The product of that act; a list of declined forms.
( grammar ) A way of categorizing nouns , pronouns , or adjectives according to the inflections they receive.
